Token.Abstract: A PWMapView object provides an embeddable map interface. It is similar to the one provided by the maps application but is specifically tailored to indoor maps. PWMapView subclasses MKMapView to provide a convenient interface that downloads, stores and displays indoor maps and associated points of interest (POIs). Usage of this class is optional but recommended for basic indoor map implementations.
The delegate for the map. The PWMapViewDelegate inherits from MKMapViewDelegate.
The delegate for the map. The PWMapViewDelegate inherits from MKMapViewDelegate.
The delegate for the map. The PWMapViewDelegate inherits from MKMapViewDelegate.

The PWCampus object associated with the current map. If no campus is associated with the PWMapView, the campus will be nil.

The PWBuilding object associated with the current map. If no building is associated with the PWMapView, the building will be nil.
The PWBuilding object associated with the current map. If no building is associated with the PWMapView, the building will be nil.
The PWBuilding object associated with the current map. If no building is associated with the PWMapView, the building will be nil.

Returns the currently displayed PWFloor object. This property may be nil if no floor is displayed. Attempts to change to the same floor are ignored. When the floor change is complete, the delegate will receive a mapView:didChangeFloor: callback.

Returns the currently displayed PWFloor object. This property may be nil if no floor is displayed. Attempts to change to the same floor are ignored. When the floor change is complete, the delegate will receive a mapView:didChangeFloor: callback.

Returns the currently displayed PWBuilding object. This property may be nil if no floor is displayed. Attempts to change to the same floor are ignored. When the floor change is complete, the delegate will receive a mapView:didChangeFloor: callback.

Returns the currently displayed PWBuilding object. This property may be nil if no floor is displayed. Attempts to change to the same floor are ignored. When the floor change is complete, the delegate will receive a mapView:didChangeFloor: callback.
The current PWRoute object plotted on the map. This property will be nil if no route is displayed.

A Boolean value indicating whether the device’s current indoor location is visible in the map view. (read-only)

A Boolean value indicating whether the map should try to display the user’s indoor location. In order to display the user's indoor location, a PWLocationManager object must be registered with the map view.

A Boolean value indicating whether the map should try to display the user’s indoor location. In order to display the user's indoor location, a PWLocationManager object must be registered with the map view.
A Boolean value indicating whether the map should hide blue dot when atmospheric pressure changes indicate a floor transition. Not recommended for most setups and disabled by default.

Managed compass is an optional capability of PWLocation that improves the user experience while viewing the map by improving the alignment of the compass heading. The managed compass takes operating system readings and processes them prior to returning it to PWMapKit -- so there is no further coding required for developers once using this mode. Set to true to enable this feature (disabled by default). Note - results may vary by location, so please evaluate the performance for a given location prior to enabling this feature.

Managed compass is an optional capability of PWLocation that improves the user experience while viewing the map by improving the alignment of the compass heading. The managed compass takes operating system readings and processes them prior to returning it to PWMapKit -- so there is no further coding required for developers once using this mode. Set to true to enable this feature (disabled by default). Note - results may vary by location, so please evaluate the performance for a given location prior to enabling this feature.

Managed compass is an optional capability of PWLocation that improves the user experience while viewing the map by improving the alignment of the compass heading. The managed compass takes operating system readings and processes them prior to returning it to PWMapKit -- so there is no further coding required for developers once using this mode. Set to true to enable this feature (disabled by default). Note - results may vary by location, so please evaluate the performance for a given location prior to enabling this feature.
Initializes and returns a newly allocated map view object with the specified frame rectangle.

Parameter.Name: frame
Parameter.Abstract: The frame rectangle for the view, measured in points. The origin of the frame is relative to the superview in which you plan to add it. This method uses the frame rectangle to set the center and bounds properties accordingly.

Token.Abstract: Allows you to change the building displayed in the map view to the specified building identifier.

Parameter.Name: building
Parameter.Abstract: The building to load into the PWMapView.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Animate the camera zoom into the PWMapView.

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A block to indicate if the building is successfully displayed or not.

Token.Abstract: Allows you to change the campus displayed in the map view to the specified campus identifier

Parameter.Name: campus
Parameter.Abstract: The campus to load into the 'PWMapView'

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Animate the camera zoom into the PWMapView.

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A block to indicate if the building is successfully displayed or not.

Token.Abstract: Sets the mode used to track the user's indoor location with optional animation. This method will have no effect if an indoor location manager has not been registered with the map view.

Parameter.Name: trackingMode
Parameter.Abstract: The mode used to track the user's location. Possible values are described in PWTrackingMode.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: If YES, the new mode is animated; otherwise, it is not. This parameter affects only tracking mode changes. Changes to the user's indoor location or heading are always animated.

Token.Abstract: Register an indoor location manager provider with the map view. This location provider is started immediately and used when modifying the indoorUserTrackingMode.

Parameter.Name: locationManager
Parameter.Abstract: The location manager to register with the map view. The location manager must conform to the PWLocationManager protocol.

Token.Abstract: Unregister any indoor location manager that is registered with the map view.
Load a PWRoute object into the map view. This method will plot a basic route line on the map view. The route object must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: route
Parameter.Abstract: The PWRoute object to display in the map view.

Token.Abstract: Load a PWRoute object into the map view with specified color for the paths. This method will plot a basic route line on the map view. The route object must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: route
Parameter.Abstract: The PWRoute object to display in the map view.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: The PWRouteUIOptions object to custom the color of route path, the junction type of line, etc.

Token.Abstract: Highlight the specified PWRouteInstruction on the map. If needed, this will change the current floor to the floor of the instruction.

Parameter.Name: instruction
Parameter.Abstract: The PWRouteInstruction to display.

Token.Abstract: Display the specified PWRouteInstruction on the map and animates to its position. If needed, this will change the current floor to the required floor for the instruction.

Parameter.Name: instruction
Parameter.Abstract: The PWRouteInstruction to display.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: Specify YES if you want the map view to animate the transition to the new instruction.

Token.Abstract: Returns the current PWRouteInstruction being highlighted. If no route is displayed, this method will return nil.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The current PWRouteInstruction. Can be nil if no PWRoute is loaded or if turn-by-turn routing is not being used.

Token.Abstract: Cancel the route displayed in the map view. This method will remove the route from the map view and set the PWRoute property to nil.
Starts sharing the user's current location
Starts retrieving other user's shared locations
Stops sharing the user's current location
Stops retrieving other user's shared locations

Positions the map to the supplied center coordinate with the given zoom level and optional animation. (Deprecated: Use setCamera:animated:, setRegion:animated:, setVisibleMapRect:animated: or setVisibleMapRect:edgePadding:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: centerCoordinate
Parameter.Abstract: A CLLocationCoordinate2D object representing the latitude and longitude the map should zoom to.

Parameter.Name: zoomLevel
Parameter.Abstract: An NSUInteger value representing the zoom level the map should zoom to.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: A BOOL property to determine whether the change of map's center should be animated or not.

Token.Abstract: A convenient method to set current floor, it's working exactly the same as setCurrentFloor:. (Deprecated: Use currentFloor instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: floor
Parameter.Abstract: A PWFloor object you want to set.

Token.Abstract: Starts heading updates. (Deprecated: Create your own CLLocationManager for heading service, since v3.2.0)
Stops heading updates. (Deprecated: Create your own CLLocationManager for heading service, since v3.2.0)
Repositions the map's view to a custom location. (Deprecated: Use setCamera:animated: or setCenter:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: location
Parameter.Abstract: A custom location reference where the map should navigate to.

Token.Abstract: Repositions the map's view to an specific point-of-interest. (Deprecated: Use setCamera:animated: or setCenter:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: poi
Parameter.Abstract: A point-of-interest reference where the map should navigate to.

Token.Abstract: Returns the annotation view of a PointOfInterest. (Deprecated: Use viewForAnnotation: or setCenter:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: poi
Parameter.Abstract: The point-of-interest. This parameter must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Displays the array of Points of Interest, causing the map view to zoom in/out to contain all of the points of interest. (Deprecated: Use showAnnotations:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: pois
Parameter.Abstract: An array of PWPointOfInterest objects that should be displayed on the map.

Token.Abstract: Selects a PointOfInterest on the map. (Deprecated: Use selectAnnotations:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: poi
Parameter.Abstract: A PointOfInterest to select on the map.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: A BOOL property to determine whether the change of map's region should be animated or not.

Token.Abstract: Deselects a PointOfInterest on the map. If the POI is not selected, this method does nothing (Deprecated: Use deselectAnnotations:animated: instead, since v3.2.0)

Parameter.Name: poi
Parameter.Abstract: A PointOfInterest to deselect on the map.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: A BOOL property to determine whether the change of map's region should be animated or not.
